page.title: 18Caving in Goatchurch Cavern.
page.content: We walked up a shallow stream to the cave entrance.We were wearing belts, helmets,lamps and batteries.We looked like miners.We looked after each other and moved along slowly.The caves were formed by water erosion.We could see higher cave entrances worn by earlier water levels.We looked at and touched the stalagmites and stalactites of various shapes and sizes.Many long ones had been broken off and removed many years ago and so the cave is no longer used by visitors.Many sea shell fossils were spotted.The csve had probably been lived in and numberous animal bones have been found.We went to the end of the top level and returned by the same route but other more difficult routes with other exits exist.We thanked our guides Derek and Michael Briggs.
